categories.name: Full Stack Development
categories.description: Complete web development stack from frontend to backend and core programming languages

skills.name: HTML5
skills.description: HTML5 is the latest evolution of the standard markup language for structuring and presenting content on the Internet.

skills.name: CSS3
skills.description: CSS3 is the newest version of the Cascading Style Sheets language, used for describing the look and formatting of a document written in HTML.

skills.name: Sass
skills.description: Sass is a preprocessor scripting language that is interpreted or compiled into CSS.

skills.name: Tailwind CSS
skills.description: Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS framework for rapidly building custom user interfaces directly in your markup.

skills.name: Bootstrap
skills.description: Bootstrap is a popular open-source CSS framework directed at responsive, mobile-first front-end web development.

skills.name: Foundation CSS
skills.description: Foundation is a responsive front-end framework that makes it easy to design beautiful responsive websites, apps, and emails.

skills.name: React
skills.description: React is an open-source JavaScript library for building user interfaces, maintained by Facebook and a community of developers.

skills.name: Alpine.js
skills.description: Alpine.js is a minimal framework for composing JavaScript behavior in your HTML, similar to Vue or React but much lighter.

skills.name: Next.js
skills.description: Next.js is a React framework that enables server-side rendering and static website generation for React-based web applications.

skills.name: Three.js
skills.description: Three.js is a cross-browser JavaScript library and API used to create and display animated 3D computer graphics in a web browser.

skills.name: Node.js
skills.description: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform JavaScript runtime environment that executes JavaScript code outside a web browser.

skills.name: Express.js
skills.description: Express.js is a minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework that provides a robust set of features for web and mobile applications.

skills.name: GraphQL
skills.description: GraphQL is an open-source data query and manipulation language for APIs, and a runtime for fulfilling queries with existing data.

skills.name: JavaScript
skills.description: JavaScript is a dynamic, interpreted programming language that enables interactive web pages and is a core technology of the World Wide Web.

skills.name: TypeScript
skills.description: TypeScript is a strongly typed programming language that builds on JavaScript, giving you better tooling at any scale.

skills.name: Python
skills.description: Python is a high-level, interpreted programming language known for its readability and versatility.

skills.name: Java
skills.description: Java is a high-level, class-based, object-oriented programming language designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible.

skills.name: C#
skills.description: C# is a modern, object-oriented programming language developed by Microsoft for building a wide range of applications.

skills.name: C
skills.description: C is a general-purpose, procedural computer programming language supporting structured programming.

skills.name: C++
skills.description: C++ is a general-purpose programming language created as an extension of the C programming language, with object-oriented features.

skills.name: Kotlin
skills.description: Kotlin is a modern, statically typed programming language that targets the JVM and JavaScript, developed by JetBrains.

skills.name: Lua
skills.description: Lua is a lightweight, high-level, multi-paradigm programming language designed primarily for embedded use in applications.

skills.name: Bash
skills.description: Bash is a Unix shell and command language written as a free software replacement for the Bourne shell.

skills.name: PowerShell
skills.description: PowerShell is a task automation and configuration management framework from Microsoft, consisting of a command-line shell and scripting language.

skills.name: Electron.js
skills.description: Electron.js is a framework for building cross-platform desktop applications with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.

categories.name: Database & Data
categories.description: Database systems and data formats for storing and managing information

skills.name: MySQL
skills.description: MySQL is an open-source relational database management system based on SQL.

skills.name: PostgreSQL
skills.description: PostgreSQL is a powerful, open-source object-relational database system with a strong reputation for reliability and feature robustness.

skills.name: SQLite
skills.description: SQLite is a C-language library that implements a small, fast, self-contained, high-reliability, full-featured, SQL database engine.

skills.name: MariaDB
skills.description: MariaDB is a community-developed, commercially supported fork of the MySQL relational database management system.

skills.name: MongoDB
skills.description: MongoDB is a source-available cross-platform document-oriented database program.

skills.name: JSON
skills.description: JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is an open standard file format and data interchange format that uses human-readable text to store and transmit data objects.

skills.name: XML
skills.description: XML (Extensible Markup Language) is a markup language that defines a set of rules for encoding documents in a format that is both human-readable and machine-readable.

skills.name: YAML
skills.description: YAML is a human-readable data-serialization language, commonly used for configuration files and data exchange between languages with different data structures.

skills.name: CSV
skills.description: CSV (Comma-Separated Values) is a simple file format used to store tabular data, such as a spreadsheet or database.

categories.name: Design & Media
categories.description: Creative tools for design, video editing, and audio production

skills.name: Figma
skills.description: Figma is a collaborative web application for interface design, with additional offline features enabled by desktop applications.

skills.name: Photoshop
skills.description: Adobe Photoshop is a raster graphics editor developed and published by Adobe Inc. for Windows and macOS.

skills.name: GIMP
skills.description: GIMP (GNU Image Manipulation Program) is a free and open-source raster graphics editor used for image retouching and editing.

skills.name: Affinity Photo
skills.description: Affinity Photo is a raster graphics editor developed by Serif for macOS, iOS, and Windows.

skills.name: After Effects
skills.description: Adobe After Effects is a digital visual effects, motion graphics, and compositing application developed by Adobe Systems.

skills.name: Premiere Pro
skills.description: Adobe Premiere Pro is a timeline-based video editing software application developed by Adobe Inc.

skills.name: DaVinci Resolve
skills.description: DaVinci Resolve is a color grading, visual effects, and non-linear video editing application for macOS, Windows, and Linux.

skills.name: FL Studio
skills.description: FL Studio is a digital audio workstation (DAW) developed by the Belgian company Image-Line.

categories.name: Game Development
categories.description: Game engines and 3D tools for creating interactive experiences

skills.name: SketchUp
skills.description: SketchUp is a 3D modeling computer program for a wide range of drawing applications such as architectural, interior design, landscape architecture, civil and mechanical engineering, film and video game design.

skills.name: Unity
skills.description: Unity is a cross-platform game engine developed by Unity Technologies, used to create both three-dimensional and two-dimensional video games.

skills.name: Unreal Engine
skills.description: Unreal Engine is a powerful real-time 3D creation tool developed by Epic Games, widely used for game development and visualization.

skills.name: Construct 3
skills.description: Construct 3 is a browser-based game engine that allows you to create 2D games without coding, using visual scripting and event sheets.

skills.name: Panda3D
skills.description: Panda3D is a free, open-source 3D game engine and framework for Python and C++ programs, developed by Disney and maintained by Carnegie Mellon University.

skills.name: Blender
skills.description: Blender is a free and open-source 3D creation suite supporting the entirety of the 3D pipelineâ€”modeling, rigging, animation, simulation, rendering, and motion tracking.

categories.name: DevOps, Tools & AI/ML
categories.description: Development tools, version control, deployment technologies, and machine learning frameworks

skills.name: Git
skills.description: Git is a free and open-source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency.

skills.name: Docker
skills.description: Docker is a set of platform as a service products that use OS-level virtualization to deliver software in packages called containers.

skills.name: Dockerfile
skills.description: Dockerfile is a text document that contains all the commands a user could call on the command line to assemble an image.

skills.name: Koyeb
skills.description: Koyeb is a serverless platform for deploying applications globally with automatic scaling and zero configuration.

skills.name: AWS
skills.description: Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a subsidiary of Amazon providing on-demand cloud computing platforms and APIs.

skills.name: TensorFlow
skills.description: TensorFlow is an end-to-end open-source platform for machine learning developed by Google.

skills.name: PyTorch
skills.description: PyTorch is an open-source machine learning library based on the Torch library, used for applications such as computer vision and natural language processing.
